importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period from the Hamas attack on October 7, 2023, to the announcement of Hanegbi's dismissal in October 2025 reflects the ongoing political and strategic tensions within Israel’s national security apparatus.

keyTakeAways: Tzachi Hanegbi, Israel’s national security adviser, was dismissed by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu amid growing tensions over Israel’s war on Gaza and disagreements over military strategy, particularly regarding Gaza City and potential negotiations with Hamas.
Hanegbi publicly admitted responsibility for the failures leading to the October 7, 2023, Hamas attack, calling for a 'thorough investigation' to restore trust and learn lessons.

Netanyahu appointed Gil Reich, the deputy head of the National Security Council, as acting head of the NSC, signaling a shift in leadership and possibly a move toward more compliant or aligned security policy.
The firing has sparked criticism from opposition figures like Gadi Eisenkot, who accused Netanyahu and his cabinet of evading accountability and replacing officials with 'yes-men'.
The incident reflects deep divisions within Israel’s leadership over how to approach the Gaza conflict and the internal responsibility for the October 7 attack.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has dismissed national security adviser Tzachi Hanegbi, amid growing tensions over Israel’s war on Gaza and disagreements over military strategy, particularly Hanegbi’s opposition to a full military takeover of Gaza City and his support for a partial deal with Hamas. Hanegbi, who served as adviser since 2023, publicly admitted responsibility for failures leading to the October 7, 2023, Hamas attack and called for a thorough investigation to restore public trust. Netanyahu has appointed Gil Reich, the deputy head of the National Security Council, as acting head of the NSC. The move has drawn criticism from opposition figures like Gadi Eisenkot, who accused the government of evading accountability and replacing officials with compliant allies. This leadership change reflects deeper divisions within Israel’s security and political elite over how to manage the ongoing Gaza conflict and the response to the October 7 attack.
title: Israel’s Netanyahu fires national security chief amid Gaza tensions
